author: Alexander Osipovich
title: Glitch Hits Trading of Amazon, Google Shares on NYSE
text:
The New York Stock Exchange temporarily suspended trading of shares of Amazon Inc., Google parent Alphabet Inc. and several other Nasdaq-listed stocks due to a technical glitch on its flagship exchange.
The issue, which NYSE announced in a notice emailed to traders at 12:24 p.m. New York time on Wednesday, had no impact on the vast majority of investors. Thatâ€™s because stocks are traded on multiple other exchanges, and shares in Amazon and Alphabet could still be traded elsewhere even while being suspended at the NYSE.
